122.content:
Flonne was an angel trainee who lived a peacefull life in the land of Celestia. That is until the day that Master Lamington chose her to be his "secret agent" and sent her on a mission to assassinate the demon king Krichevskoy.

"Okay," said the little blonde angel with a cheer, "I'm finally here. I still don't know why I was picked to be an assassin. Maybe I've got some kind of a special skill that Master Lamington knows about, oh this might be kind of neat," she said as she rushed into the castle.

Flonne instantly switched into "secret agent" mode and started running through the castle, hiding behind suits of armor, pillars, or whatever else she could find. She thought she was being stealthy because none of the guards noticed her, but little did she know that as she ran she kept making her own sound effects. "Whoosh, nin nin!" Because of this everyone she ran past saw her, they just didn't care enough to try and stop her.

Eventually she made her way to a massive dining hall that was empty, but full of food. "Oh look, is somebody having a party. Oh I love parties, I wonder who it's for." She looked around at all the tasty snacks and tried to fight the urge to take a bite out of them. "Wait, I'm not here to eat, I'm here to find Krichevskoy. But the more that I think about it, the stranger I feel about this. I don't feel right killing a stranger. But then again I wouldn't feel right about killing someone I know either." Without realizing it she had sat down in one of the chairs, and as she started thinking out loud she had also begun eating.

"...and that's it for the news. Tune in tomorrow as we provide coverage on tonight's Prinny Baseball game. The Blighted Bachiel are gunning for the top spot so far, but can they compete with tenacious speed of the Lucky Feylnn 13? Stay tuned..."

1231.content:
Plenair looked around. She could see a RozenQueen vendor not too far from the studio, selling sweets. Even if she didn't need to recover her Hit Points, right now she needed to take care of her Hunger Points.

The vendor, a female red mage, was taken aback as she saw Plenair approach. Holding out a purse with a good 20,000 HL inside, it only took a glance at her face to somehow tell Plenair wanted some food.

"..."

Somehow taken aback in shock by what could be considered an impatient look on Plenair's face, the mage girl presented her with as much as her money would afford: Three plates of flan and a chocolate bar. Plenair just stared, not even smiling but in a way seemed to show gratitude. Yes, she did because we say so now shut up.

It didn't take Plenair long to sit down and dig into the chocolate, while pulling a spoon out of nowhere and starting to dig into the flan. Whatever the reason, Rosenqueen sweets weren't bad at all even for a mass Netherworlds wide chain but it the sweet flan tasted exceptionally good today somehow, the rich creamy caramel melding with the smooth, milky chocolate as well as the delicious cocoa of her chocolate bar. Her meal passed by in a haze, as Plenair looked down and saw six clean plates and an empty wrapper. Somehow she still felt hungry as she looked down, her stomach growling and her sweet tooth craving more.

She presented the mage with another payment, this time a healthier sum of about 33,000 HL. A bit puzzled and perplexed, the mage saw no need to protest as business was business and presented Plenair with some eclairs and flan. Plenair tore through them all, a faintest evident expression of delight on her face as she ate and ate, cooing quietly as only she could hear herself while eating. Her stomach seemed to bulge forward as the silent mascot became further stuffed, rising out and sticking out under her white dress. It continued to grow larger and rounder as she ate, more sweets piling inside of it; cake, flan, eclairs, sundaes, candy...whatever she could eat, Plenair would eat! She seemed to eat faster too, despite an expression of what could be considered discomfort on her face and her stomach was so full and stuffed.

Plenair herself, however, was not unaware of this. However, she felt too hungry to really bother thinking and kept eating, kept shoveling in food, kept on feasting on sweets. She finally stopped herself once she finally felt legitimately full, her hunger pangs subsiding and her belly standing out in front of her by about a good three feet. Plenair sat down on the pavement, feeling her legs get tired supporting her bloated belly.

"..."

She looked down at her swollen gut in an expression barely reading in disbelief. Why was she suddenly so hungry? All she could think of was taking a break on Veldime after she was summoned by that group of adventurers, that Adell guy who was a fan of hers and his companion Rozalin. Ever since then, she felt her appetite increase in droves, working herself up to make sure she didn't pack on weight by tackling the Item World in her spare time. But it seemed now her cravings were starting to catch up with her.

124.content:
Dozing fretfully, a young blonde tossed and turned in her bed, while her eyes flitted behind her eyelids as horrid dreams played and replayed, scenarios where she was murdering innocent villagers or destroying countless homes. With each whimper, the guards outside her room winced.

"I truly feel sorry for Lady Rozalin..." the first said, his beefy arms crossed over his scarred, bare chest. The chains around his wrists clinked with each movement, and he quickly snatched at them to silence the sound. "I mean, rejected by Sir Adell for something she couldn't even help."

"Yeah! What a meanie! He needs to get his head out of his butt and screwed on straight!" the second guard agreed, nodding furiously and bobbing on her furry feet restlessly, almost tempted to do a few flips to get the anxiety out of her system.

"Mai...be quiet. Kai...I agree with you." a third guard said quietly yet solidly, his eyes hard as he glared over the collar of his steel lined, dark blue trenchcoat. Standing straight up next to the door, he sighed. "Adell had his reasons. After all, our lord was and now once again is the most feared Overlord in all the cosmos."

The clicking of boots could be heard moments later, silencing the chatter of the three as the head of all of Rozalin's guards walked around the corner, his arms folded like Kai's, though over a gleaming gold vest. Boots as black as onyx clicked on the marble floors, and his dark blonde hair fanned out behind him due to his swift gait.

"The three of you are to shut up NOW. You will be quiet about Lady Rozalin's dilemma, you will not speak of Adell. You will guard the room against attackers and you will do so SILENTLY. Otherwise I will personally hurl you into the Dark Sun. I will not have gossip floating amongst my soldiers. Is that CLEAR?"

"YES LORD FENRIR!" the three terrified soldiers replied, arranging into a more effective formation for observation. Their stiff straight posture seemed to be adequate, as the imposing Omega Sentinel turned and clicked away, pushing up his sleeve to look at his watch.

"Nearly time for the chefs to begin preparing the Mistresses breakfast...I just pray that those three imbeciles don't wake her prematurely. I just wish that she would allow me to deal with them. Ah well. When Mistress Rozalin orders something, I follow..." Fenrir said quietly, heading off to the kitchen to head the preparation of breakfast.

1241.content:
As morning dawned, the young Lady Rozalin stirred, sitting up and stretching. Swinging her slim legs off of the bed, she scratched her scalp and opened her eyes slowly.

"A beautiful day, as always." she cooed, a smile decorating her face. "Phooey on Adell...if he doesn't want to share this life with me, then it's his own fault!"

Her mood greatly improved from a few days ago, Rozalin stood and strode over to her closet, flinging it open and humming to herself. A dark crimson skirt was thrown on first, fluttering to her knees and hiding her shapely lower half. After that, a black silk shirt was adorned, her tiny wings poking out and her naturally large bosom accentuated by the clingy fabric. A pair of red satin gloves followed, as well as a pair of gold bracelets to cinch the gloves tightly so they wouldn't fall off. Finally, she set about the task of pulling her hair up into a ponytail, as she had grown so accustomed to.

"Lady Rozalin? Are you awake?" a deep voice called as her door clicked open. A shock of dark blonde hair poked out from behind the door, giving Rozalin a perfect idea of who the person was.

"Thiel...even if I weren't awake when you first came in, I think I would be after you opened your mouth. I swear, your voice is like a gong being struck." she chuckled, the figure audibly letting out a relieved breath of air and stepping in.

"I'm sorry milady. I've been trying recently to change my voice, but previous lives have a habit of edging in." the Omega Sentinel said lightly, his voice now more smooth and sophisticated, more fitting of his race. Striding over to his mistress, he bowed slightly before smiling. "After all, two lives call for two voices. Am I right?"

"Not necessarily. Now, to what do I owe the pleasure of my most trusted vassal?" Rozalin asked, her smile fading as she struggled with her ponytail. Thiel took over, gently guiding her hair through the tie and even fanning it out in the manner that most of her servants took as something natural.

As he finished, he stepped back and bowed again, not wanting his mistress to be offended by his presence. "I'm just here to inform you that breakfast is ready. I personally supervised the chefs this time, ensuring that you would have enough food, unlike yesterday."

"Oh...stand up. I may have been strict in a past life, but that's no reason to walk on eggshells in front of me." she laughed as her stomach snarled more loudly than a Baciel, causing her to blush as brightly as the red sun outside.

"I can tell, especially when you look so adorable and make such vulnerable noises." Thiel joked, getting a smack on the head with the lady's fan for his wit. "Now come on. Breakfast will get cold if we don't hurry."

12411.content:
Rozalin let out a petite burp as she caressed her swollen gut. She had consumed an entire day's worth of food, just as her breakfast. Yet she was still hungry. Patting her engorged belly, which was bulging visibly, even with her dress covering it, she called for Thiel.

"Thiel! Could you come here, please?" Thiel Fenrir obeyed immediately, as he had been patiently guarding the door to the dining hall. He strode in, boots thudding slightly on the rich carpet.

"You called, milady?" he asked. His eyes immediately traveled to her dress, where the taut bulge that was once her flat stomach was sitting quite visibly. She must've been hungry, he thought. "What do you need?"

"Could you ask the chefs to make another meal, about twice the size of this one? I'm afraid I'm still feeling hungry." She smiled at him. He smiled too, a little uneasily though. It was very unusual for her to be this hungry. And even after she devoured enough to feed two people. Thiel bowed slightly and swept out the door, a worried look on his face. What caused this to happen-? Before he knew it, he was at the entrance to the kitchens, the delicious smells wafting through the corridors. Stepping in, one of the head chefs clapped her hands and bowed to him. The rest of the cooks followed suit.

"Welcome back, Master Thiel. What does our lady require of us now?" a plump succubus said, clearly the master chef by her size. She had an impressive bust, each breast about the size of a spherical watermelon. Her thick, wide hips swayed left to right with every little motion of her wings, with her smooth, fat thighs following soon after. Her ponderous belly flowed into her lap, obscuring what little there was in the ways of covering her nethers.

"Our lady asks for another course, Mariana," Thiel said. The succubus went wide-eyed. "Only this time, double it."

"Are you sure, Master Thiel? That is far too much food for a person such as our lady! She would surely burst."

Thiel shook his head. "I'm not entirely sure. When I left, her stomach filled her lap, taut with her meal, and yet it continued to roar in hunger. Someone must've put something in the ingredients. But enough of that! Lady Rozalin is possibly starving at this moment."

"Understood, Master." He left. The cooks, mostly all succubi with exceedingly plump bodies, exchanged worried glances with each other. Who would tamper with the Lady Rozalin's food? Mariana sighed and shook her mane of blond hair. "Well ladies, it's time to head back to work..."
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
After about an hour, the food arrived. Rozalin's tummy was roaring up a storm so bad it hurt her. Even though she knew it was filled up, it just didn't register being full. A knock on the door came, followed by the sound of Mariana's voice.

"Milady, we've brought your breakfast. May we enter?" Rozalin called "Yes!" and beckoned them to enter. What they were carrying almost made her jaw drop. But that would be unladylike. Seven different succubi, all of different classes, carried in the largest platters she had ever seen, covered in pancakes and omelets, croissants and french toast, sausages, bacon, biscuits, and grits. Greasy, fatty grits. Rozalin smiled and picked up her fork, ready for her feast.

"Thank you all. You may be excused." "Thank you, milady," they all chanted before flying out, wings flapping ever so often to keep them afloat. Rozalin pulled a plate of eggs to her and tucked in.

Finishing her meal, Rozalin slumped back into her chair, holding her swollen belly and groaning quietly. Her eyes were half open, her mind clouded over in a sheer gluttonous stupor, which was all the more apparent now that her tummy hung bare in her lap.

"Ugh...gotta...get to bed..." she mumbled, her manners completely out the window as she stood clumsily, her tummy taking a tumble as gravity took hold, yanking her along with it and causing a yelp of pain to escape her lips.

"Milady!" Thiel called, rushing over and scooping her up, noticing tears in her eyes. "I'm so sorry...I should have been watching." He said, wiping Rozalin's tears away gently before noticing she had dozed straight off. Carrying her along, Mariana exited the kitchen through a back door, eager to see how her mistress was faring, only to have her face fall.

"What happened, Thiel?" she asked, noticing the look of discomfort on Rozalin's sleeping face. Her heart fell, her mind wracked with a hint of guilt that it was one of her meals that had put her mistress in such a shape.

"Her chair broke. Seems that even ones made for the giant that was the former Zenon can't hold our Mistress for very long when someone tampers with her food..." he replied, now smelling a faint hint of various non-lethal toxins. Mariana looked shocked as Thiel went on. "It seems someone wanted to place the new Zenon out of commission, yet not kill her, and they found an effective way to do so. Lady Rozalin never was one to handle poisons very well."

"But...but...who could have done so? You personally supervised the preparation of the food, and you would have caught any whiff of poison. Right?" Mariana asked, following Thiel as he carried the now-sleeping Rozalin to her chambers. Entering, Thiel set the sleeping girl down and smiled, brushing a strand of hair from her eyes and patting her big, gurgling tummy before motioning for Mariana to follow him.

"I should have, though this nose isn't what it used to be. We'll just have to be cautious. I think it's high time that instead of the chefs cooking, they supervise. I've been thinking of outsourcing recently, and I have just the people in mind." he chuckled, while Mariana simply looked puzzled.

As Rozalin slept her monstrous meal away, Thiel set about his various tasks, directing Mariana to get the chefs ready for their new "guests" and the rest of the personnel to gather in the main hall. After a swift investigation, Theil chuckled as he hauled the five offenders to the roof of the palace, where he turned and faced them..

"The infamous 'Idiot Ais'...I should have known. You do realize that Lady Rozalin was just learning how to use her pistol back then, right?" Thiel chided, grabbing the Sinner that had guarded Rozalin the night before and hurling him skywards, much to the dismay of the others.

"She still shot us full of holes!" the Felynn protested, her ample belly and rear the hint that Thiel had needed to close the case, as was the fact that she was currently munching on a monstrously huge chocolate bar.

"That does not exempt you from your crimes." he said, sighing and throwing the Iron Knight towards the east, a comically long yell echoing as he flew.

"It should! I mean, we didn't kill her or anything!" a voluptuous female Fighter said, crossing her arms over her substantial bust. She had added another clue thanks to her blimped hourglass shape., much to Thiel's amusement.

"But it DOES NOT." he growled, snatching at the third Ai brother and pitching him downwards, burying him deep in the ground.

"Please! Spare us!" Mai yowled, getting to her knees and clasping her paws. "We'll do anything! We've already been affected by our own poison, and our figures are ruined...we'll serve without pay if we have to!"

Sai, the Fighter, nodded in agreement. "Yeah! Heck, we'll be Lady Rozalin's private handmaidens, if she'll have us! I've always been better at dressing people up than slicing them down, after all."

"Very well...I'll speak with the Mistress. I have other things to attend to anyways. Dinner may very well be an occasion for the century!" Thiel chuckled, turning and clicking down the stairs.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
"So...you're the Pirate Chefs?" Thiel asked an especially gruff looking sage with a peg leg.

"Chef Pirates, actually. Keeps us from getting sued by riled-up manga-ka." The leader of the Chef Pirates responded, a buff Baciel with an especially large chefs hat adorning its head and a peg leg.

"I see...anyways, I'm skeptical now that I see you. I mean, Baciels and Wood Golems cooking? You only have one arm, and from my experience you're fairly slow." Thiel said, crossing his arms.

Chuckling as though he had heard the argument before, the head chef turned and grabbed a frying pan, cracking a few eggs into it and holding it over his plasma cannon. Creating a gentle stream of energy from it, he had a delicious looking omelet done in a matter of seconds. "Slow we may be, but we've got built in tools." he said, flipping the egg dish perfectly onto a plate. "And call me Beff. This is my first mate, Tonji." he added, nodding to a blonde haired Sinner, who nodded slightly and said nothing.

"Nice to meet all of you. Anyways...is there any chance you can begin preparing dinner? I'm guessing Lady Rozalin will be ravenous when she wakes up, thanks to treachery performed earlier in the day."

"Of course! A pity about that too...no one should ever tamper with food. It's just downright dishonest!" Beff growled, tromping over to Thiel and clapping his hand on the Sentinel's shoulder. "Trust me, we've got the best Mystic Beasts in the business. If any poison gets in the food, we'll know about it!"

Nodding in satisfaction, Thiel shook the Baciel's hand and made to leave. As he left, he bumped quite literally into Mariana, who blushed and chuckled. "My my...I didn't know you were so starved for attention, Lord Thiel." she joked as he came up for air.

"Very funny. Mariana, I have news for you. I'll be reassigning you and your staff. I'll be running this by Beff tomorrow, but perhaps it's time we tricked the population of the castle. Two cooking forces might foil anyone trying to poison Lady Rozalin."

"That's not a bad idea...besides...I've heard of these Pirates. Their cooking is none too refined. Nothing befitting our mistress..." she agreed, nodding.

"Well, for now, I think it's time we rested up for dinner. It may be an interesting event, if my guess is correct."

12411211.content:
Later that night, Thiel and Mariana entered Lady Rozalin's bedroom, noticing she had awakened and was playing with her newly acquired tummy.

"I'm glad to see you're awake, milady!" Thiel said, bowing low. "Are you feeling much better now that you've had time to...well...digest?"

"Of course I am." Rozalin replied, swinging her legs out of the bed and standing up, revealing that she had plumped up quite nicely from her breakfast binge. Her bosom, naturally large, was now straining her top beyond belief, the poor shirt just unable to cover both them and her new potbelly. As she stood there, her tummy hung just below her waist, a pale and smooth outcropping.

Below, her hips flared out with squishy padding, and combined with her chubby buns, they had blown the button off of her pants, while her widened thighs were straining the legs. She took a few steps over, her body quivering, and chuckled.

"In fact...I could say I feel better than ever. It's much warmer in here now that I have my own built-in padding, you know." she joked, poking her squishy midriff.

Thiel stared in amazement for a few moments before Mariana knocked him on the head, bringing him to his senses. Clearing his throat, he offered his hand to his mistress. "M...milady, what we came here for was to escort you to dinner." he stammered, using a slight coughing motion to mask wiping a trickle of blood away from his nose.

"That'd be great! Oh...but why are you here, Mariana?" Rozalin asked, addressing the plump succubus.

"Thiel relieved me of my duties as head chef. At least for the main population of the castle. A small handful of people will be assisting in making your dinner, while we recruited a well known band of pirates to work on the food for the main population alongside the already present force. We're using a few wolves to sniff out any potential hazards, so there shouldn't be any poisons in tonight's meal." Mariana said, going through the speech that Thiel had prepared to soothe Rozalin's nerves.

"Oh...very well then!" she said, shrugging and taking Thiel's hand and leading him from the room, the poor Sentinel being dragged along while Mariana simply followed, giggling lightly at his predicament.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Sitting at a large table alongside Thiel and Mariana, Rozalin massaged her grumbling tummy, eager to begin eating. Thiel and Mariana smiled as the doors to the private room opened, a busty red-headed Overlord clad in s leotard entered, smiling gently at the assembled people.

"Lady Rozalin! I've heard so much about you from Mariana and Thiel." Overlord Prier gushed, striding over and smiling. "Though not about your waistline!" she giggled, poking the larger girl's tummy.

"Well you aren't very up to date!" Rozalin replied, a titter escaping her lips as her belly bounced. "Thiel, Mariana...you never told me you knew Lady Prier!"

"...I'm one of the first people she decked in the Dark World...made me work with her and those other demon exterminators..." Thiel mumbled, looking away as the three girls laughed.

"And I used to be one of her servants until I was enlisted by that Fake Zenon. To be honest, the reason I and the others have such nice figures is because of the recipes she brought to the Underworld with her! They're just so scrumptious!"

Rozalin and Prier smiled, only to hear Rozalin's tummy snarl in hunger. "Heh heh...guess I'm really hungry."

"Well then let's get eating!" Prier said, sitting down across from Thiel just as a stream of Sinners and plump Succubi started to place tray after tray on the table.

"Hey...these are some good looking dishes!" Thiel said, lifting one of the lids to reveal an entire deboned and glazed Abraxas. "Though a bit unnerving...I guess only Pirates would have the guts to cook something like this."

Hearing lids clatter on the floor, Thiel looked up to see his three female companions eagerly digging in. Chuckling, he pushed his tray away and secretly pulled out a round purple case. Popping a pill out of it, he swallowed it and sat back to enjoy the show.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

A few minutes prior...

"Everything's looking perfect, Beff. Just let me know if you need any additional assistance. I can always call for one or two more people from Mariana's staff to help you." Thiel said, smiling and clapping a hand on Beff's large shoulder as he grilled a massive steak for the soldiers.

"Will do!" Beff replied, tossing the steak behind him onto a mammoth pile.

Thiel simply walked away, though a door into the portion of the kitchen reserved for Lady Rozalin's private chefs. Looking over the dishes, he smiled slightly as he pulled out a tiny packet. Sprinkling tiny amounts of a fine powder onto each dish, he looked over a pudgy Felynn's shoulder, smiling his winning smile and slipping his arm around, managing to sprinkle the last of it on the dish. Striding from the kitchen, he adjusted his vest and headed off, eager to deliver Mariana's lunch to her.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Watching the three demonesses stuff their faces, Thiel glanced at his nails for a moment before getting up, striding over to Rozalin and scooting a large plate of Gehenna Goulash in front of her. His next stop was Prier, and a heaping platter of Deep Fried Dragon Wings was placed in front of her gently. Over to Mariana, and he grinned as he set a large platter of Barbecued Basilicrow. Giving each girl's rounded tummy a quick pat and rub, he walked over to the door, ready to shout the alarm when they finished eating.

"My my...such a lovely breakfast..." she murmured, rubbing her eyes sleepily and scooting the chair back. "If only I could indulge like this every day. But that would wreak havoc on my figure." She added with a chuckle.

Striding into the hall, Thiel smiled at her and crossed his arms as he drew near. "I take it everything was to your liking?" he asked with a grin, resulting in a playful glare from Rozalin.

"Nope! Everything was downright horrible!" She replied, giggling gently as she stood up. A tiny potbelly poked through the fabric of her gown, leaving the normally slim Overlord with what looked like an undersized bowling ball for her midriff.

"Why Lady Rozalin, I'm offended!" a playfully seductive voice chimed in, the owner drifting up and chuckling. "I had my chefs pour their heart and soul into those dishes you gobbled up with such abandon!"

It really has been a routine existence in the Evil Academy lately, ever since Mao defeated the Super Hero Auram and basically became the new Dean of the school (and in the process the Overlord as well), things have been strangely quiet as of late...well as quiet as a school full of evil demons can be anyways. At least in their sense, there was the usual ditching of class, learning how to backstab and basically be the evil beings they were meant to be by nature.Surely a place such as this, which is sometimes regarded as 'the root of all evil in the netherworld' hasn't any business being so quiet and uneventful, well things may take a change for the better as we begin this tale...let's watch shall we?

-Somewhere within the School (there's really no telling where, being it constantly expands)...-

"Geeze, it sure has been boring around here" Sighed a martial artist, as he lazily strolled through the halls his hands behind his head and a bored look in his sharp eyes. It would appear so being he has been wandering these halls for more than a couple hours, of course he himself hasn't been keeping track of exactly how many hours he's been roaming about...Math isn't really his best subject anyways. "When is something gonna happen already, I'm just itchin' to test my new 'Blazing Tiger Flame Punch' on someone!"

"I don't know, Ojisama, I sort of like it this way~" Came the soft of Ojisama's sole pupil, Niku. However she was a female warrior who had appearantly wanted to study how to use fists rather than her swords. And even though she was enthusiastic about her training, she was rather terrible one in terms of skills, often screwing up on her techniques or forgetting how to perform them, although her terrible skill is backed by amazing luck in which case whenever she screws up something good may come out of her own mistake. It has happened more than once during her time spent in the Academy, and has given her the title of 'Uber Jynx'. Despite this, she still considers Ojisama her greates rival even though he has no title to speak of for himself. "But, if it's action you want then I've heard that there's a new club that an Honor Student had started not too long ago, I'm thinking about asking Kyoko-senpai if she's joining."

"Eh? Since when did an Honor Student start a club...and more importantly why, haven't I heard anything about it?..." Ojisama answered in a tone of surprise as he stopped for a few moments and stared at Niku who shook her head and tried not to laugh at her friend's obvious stupidity on the matter...Ojisama falls true into the archetype of being physically powerful but mentally incompetent, often not paying much attention to his surroundings or using his impulse alone to go through problems which usually only make things alot worse than normal.

"That's because you hardly pay attention to anything, Knucklehead" Niku teased as she knocked on his forehead with the back of her knuckle, hollow 'conk' sound emitting from Ojisama's head as she did so. It would appear that there's almost nothing inside Ojisama's head except vacant space...and perhaps a brain as well if you want to be in denial of the situation. "Honestly, Ojisama it's been all over the Academy, I don't see how you could miss something like this..."

The Martial artist simply shrugged as he gave his follower a blunt answer "Well, I'm not too big on rumors, they're only a waste of time."

"Actually it's more of a fact than it is a rumor..."

"It is!? Since when!?" Ojisama jumped back as if this was something he had just heard...which it wasn't.

"Whatever...Let's just go find them already..."

--------------

It didn't take much to find the demons both Ojisama and Niku were looking for, it was fairly easy to predict where they were, most demons (when not in their classes) usually congregate in the main area of the school. In the main area there were always a variety of monsters to marvel (or grimace) at, most from different grades and rankings, occasionally some legendary students like Honor Students or Class Reps stop by usually to rall their cronies to come with them to Homeroom or something of the like. But, mostly they usually only showed up to show off just how much of a big shot they were compared to the lower ranking students.

"Hey, Kyoko*-senpai~" Niku mused as she trotted over to the pink clad ninja demoness. Niku had admired Kyoko ever since she first met her during the Mao's fight with Rasberyl but, when asked as to why she admired her so, Niku refused to speak of the matter claiming it was a secret. Being Niku refused to speak on the matter most simply believed it was a passive form of breast envy(?)

Female Warriors are, in fact, flat...

"Ah, Miss Niku, good to see you again" Kyoko said with a smile (although you couldn't really due to that face mask and all), she then took notice of Ojisama lazily following behind the, obviously more energetic, Female Warrior. "Hm? Sir Ojisama, you came too?"

"Yeah, got kinda bored wandering around doin' nothin'." Ojisama yawned as he dug his pinky deep into his ear.

Niku looked around and noticed the area was short one Rasberyl and one Asuka, something that was rare within itself. "Huh? Where are Rasberyl-sama and Asuka-senpai, aren't they going to check out that club too?"

"They're on their way from buying supplies for the trip to the club" Kyoko answered "Sir Zerik here agreed to lead us to the clubroom, being we don't really know where it is" Kyoko pointed to a Battle Master who sat on the stairs, his large Demon Smasher at his side. Zerik had various scars on his naked chest and shoulders, proof of the many battles in the past he had to endure, even his crimson bandanna showed wear and tear as the end of it was singed and blackened as if someone had set it on fire recently.

Zerik used to fight along side Mao (just like Ojisama and Niku) as well, before everything was resolved in the end, that is. After which Zerik simply wandered around the school doing things to his liking and leisure, many of his close acquantices never heard from him since then. Some even thought that he had actually died somewhere within the Academy. "How's it goin'?" He greeted "It's been a long while hasn't it, I can't even remember the last time I saw you two..."

"Eh? You're joining too Zerik?" Ojisama inquired to the seasoned Battle Master who shook his head solemnly in return.

"Not really, I'm not that big of a club guy so I'd rather remain a freelancer." Zerik stated before he smirked and glanced at Ojisama "But I'll keep an eye on things though, Honor Students can be pretty brutal on new recruits, and we don't even know why this guy even founded this new club either" If one couldn't see it, then it was obvious that Zerik was hiding his interest of this mysterious club by pretending to be their body gaurds, in all honesty this was possiby the sole reason he agreed to lead them there...because he was interested in the club to begin with. If you wanted to join Zerik, there's no reason to hide it behind false senses of security.

"Indeed, but the mystery of it all is what makes the club so appealing." The pink kunoichi stated matter of factly. "But, for right now we could wait for Lady Berly and Asuka to return or we could go by ourselves, I told them I would send Sir Zerik back to get them if I did decide to go by myself."

"Hello! Welcome to the Rosenqueen Company," she said in her smooth, lilting voice. It was cheery, but it had the calm, collectiveness of an adult's tone. The proprietor quickly faltered after entering the main room, surprised to see no one there. "That's odd...I know the bell rung." Her eyes then caught a small envelope sitting on the wooden surface of the counter. It was stamped with the seal of one of the companies she sponsored at her stores. It was also stamped with the bakers' guild's seal. "What's this?"

Picking up the crisp letter, she plucked off the wax seal and unfolded an announcement. As of that day, the bakers' guild required anyone who sold their goods to taste-test them to make sure they were satisfying. At the bottom, besides the head chef's signature, was the John Hancock of Queen Crespine and her daughter, Princess Eclair. She sighed. "Well, if it's signed by the queen and the princess, then it must be official. I wonder when the new pastries will come in."

15333221.content:
'Take whatever you want, when you want'

That's the mantra a bandit always follows, life's treasures are not so easily attainable, so why not just steal what you don't have and keep if for yourself? Of course, many with morals try their best to avoid this urge to take what they desire and make it theirs, but what of those who don't? Well, in this tale we'll see just how stealing can have it's rewards and it's consequences (namely of that to a young woman's slender physique).

-Early Morning, Forest Area near Astec-

It's been quite a while since Shauna split from Endorph's gang of 'theives'. Having already been rather upset with him when he had come along and taken charge of her group all his own, everyone knew it was bound to happen, it was only a matter of when and where. Of course this isn't saying, that she didn't take along ith her some like minded vagabons, most that followed her, were already strong supports of Shauna from the very beginning, even after Endorph showed up and started calling the shots. Was Shauna concearned of where Endorhp and his gang were; absolutely not, why would she be? The only thing Shauna was after was grade A loot from the neighboring countries and villages.

Resources were always tight, especially after Shauna's decision of flying solo from Endorph's group, so this is one of the main reasons why they set up shop near Astec. As everyone knows, Astec is a hotspot for trading goods, that being said loads upon loads of supplies come through every so often. So whenever a by passing caravan comes along, Shauna would simply order her gang to steal what supplies, food or loot they could get.

With this method in play, life had been fairly easy so far, so long as they managed to elude knights and other law enforcing groups they were free to hang out anywhere near the trade route leading into Astec. Although, the main culprit for the food's disappearance, was none other than Shauna herself, even though she had help from a few Redflanks who were also fairly big eaters in their own right, she found herself eating alot more than she normally does. She did like the Hotpods that came in the caravans from time to time, so perhaps that's the answer...

For right now, everything seemed fairly calm, the few Redflanks in the group were keeping their eyes sharp for any enemies that might show up, standing gaurd not to far from the camp's entrance. A couple of Phynx lazed about the grounds, usually being the ones to carry along most of the things they stole, it was a routine to see them snoozing from time to time. The every present Pyremage that served by Shauna's side, were doing just that; the both of them seated silently on each side of their master awaiting any orders she may give to them. It's been well nearly two days since the last shipment of food was eaten up, and the gypsy was getting a bit impatient with this next caravan that was supposed to have come through here a day ago.

Either the Astec officals were wising up to them and had given the caravans a different route to use or something else was holding them up. Whatever the case maybe, they were still taking too long and Shauna was growing hungrier by the minute, the occasional snarl echoing from her toned stomach only egging on her impatience on the matter. This was getting very annoying, very quickly, Shauna snapped her gaze to the 3 Sepp Bandits who sat nearby "Hey, while you guys are talking about nothing, maybe you could tell me how we can find a little bit more food around here" Shauna remarked rather impatiently to the bandits, her arms crossed over her soft, ample bosom and an annoyed expression wrinkling her features.

"Yeah, we were just talking about that" One of the bandits replied, slightly taken aback by Shauna's outburst "These guys have been takin' alot longer to come through here lately, and we know how much you like to...erm, eat as of late, so we think we should move on to somewhere else" Shauna raised an eyebrow at the sound of this statement, where else could they possibly go that gave as much food as this route used to?

The bandit could see his chief's confusion on the matter and quickly opted to explain one of the options he had in mind. He asked for a map from a Swoardsman who shrugged and handed him the rough edged map. "There's a city right around here called Croutte" He says placing his finger on the southern most part of Prodesto, right below the Astec area "It's a decetly sized place, although no bigger than Astec, but I hear the place is still loaded with valuables...the only problem is it's located in the Ensnarelands"

Shauna was more than a little skeptical at her follower's judgement at this point. The Ensnarelands is a region of Prodesto that is infamous for trapping those who enter it inside, never for them to return to the outside again. Matter of fact, it was for this prime reason that Yesterwind was located deep within the Ensnarelands, it was an ideal area to hideout and lay low provided you know EXACTLY where you are going. Otherwise, you're doomed to get lost with the sea of trees that is the Ensnarelands. Yet, despite the forests reputation, the bandit was saying out right that there was a city near it? "You really think there's a city out there?" Shauna "Hah, from what I remember the only thing down there is nothing"

However, the bandit was not so easily detered, for despite his leaders skeptism, her pressed on. "Trust me on this one chief, I had a couple buddies who used to hangout down there, I remember the way like the back of my knife"

"Uh...the back of your knife is the same as the front, genius..." Another bandit quipped as he gave his comrade a cynical look. Truth be told, it was a rather dumb comparison.

"Shut up, you get what I'm trying to say!" "Anyways, I know the way there so I gaurentee we won't get lost"

"Fine, but if we do end up getting lost it will be on your head" Shauna conceaded, as much as she didn't trust on this bandit's word, she was still famished. So sitting here won't get her any closer to eating, she took risks before so why not now?

----------------

While speaking of thie city and planning to get there was all well and good, it was actually doing the deed that made it all the more tedious. Even though their original location was due, southeast of Astec (the Ensnarelands is south of Astec) and therefore wouldn't take as long to get to this 'Croutte', the fact that most of the group was already rather hungry made for a long journey. Most went so far as to eat Deathblossoms that nested near the forest regions. Although the ravenous plants were fairly nutrutious, they had one major drawback as far as eating was concearned: They tasted awful. And this wasn't even the challenging part of the journey, the true test came to getting through the forest and reaching their supposed destination, provided it actually existed.

Shauna leaned against a tree and sighed in exasperation, Nash and Lerouche taking to her side as she did so. Hunger no longer plauged her for her stomach had already been filled when they rested a while back, however, the gypsy's belly was bloated with the one thing she thought she would never eat; Deathblossoms. The tanned flesh of her once flat abdomen had now swollen out a small amount from her her eating her fill of plant monsters, the weight of it pushing down on her frilly purple dress that she wore, revealing a small glimpse of the curvature of where her stomach and her shapely hips connected. Although, the only real consequence of having eaten all the Deathblossoms she was offered was that Shauna still had their horrible taste lingering on her tounge, like that of a lasting curse of something most foul. Truly those who left the carnivours plants alone were right to do so, they were not only dangerous to wrangle, but also tasted like ass, but you're willing to eat anything when your hungry. "You better be damn sure of where you're going, We've been walking for almost all day and we still haven't found anything on this 'Croutte' place you were going on about before." Shauna shot to the bandit who was nosing around the area searching for something.

"Don't worry I know exactly where I'm goin" He replied looking behind a tree and the moving on to another. Needless to say this action caught the curiosity of most of the group, at least the curiosity of what exactly he was nosing around this particular area for.

"Uhm...what're you doing?" An archer asked with a rasied eyebrow, her eyes watching the bandit zip from treeside to treeside a few of the Phynx following his actions, perhaps hepling him in his endeavor.

"I marked one of these trees before a long time ago, matter fact that's how I knew where to go, because I marked the trees with arrows so I'd know where I was going" The bandit answered briefly as he disappeared into the underbrush the Phynx following behind him. With nothing really to do as of now, except wait for their comrade to return with either directions to Croutte or an apology for having dragged them to the edge of the continent for nothing, everyone decides to just take 5 for now. Shauna not arguing in the least and taking her seat at the foot of the very tree she leaned upon. "Do you need anything, Miss Shauna" The 2 Pyremages said in unison, it was weird how the both of them had a tendancy to do that. "No, I'm fine" Shauna answered with another sigh keeping her blue eyes fixated on the fleeting body of her underling who was still searching the trees for his little markings.

"I have my doubts about this whole thing" A redflank remarked, his bulky arms crossed as he followed the figure of the Sepp dashing about in the background "If this city existed then why has no one else heard of it, if it's so loaded with treasure wouldn't you think that at least one person would know where to go to actually get there?"

"You gotta point there, but what if it's location is a secret, the leader of the village was probably trying to protect the treasure they have stashed away" Replied aother bandit who yawned and plopped onto the ground as he awaited for anything new to come up.
